text:
Posted in Basketball , Main | 50 Responses 
Andy Katz’s three-point shot today is all about the Louisville scandal. Katz spoke to an NCAA expert who gave him the rundown on the penalties the Cards could face. The expert said IF the allegations are proven true, Louisville would be subject to a Level 1 case . What does that mean? According to Katz: Recruiting sanctions Scholarships taken away Postseason ban 
The expert also said the NCAA will require full cooperation from current players, former players, and recruits, and that historically, if the allegations aren’t categorically denied immediately, that’s not a good sign for the school. So far, no one in the Louisville administration, especially Rick Pitino, has denied anything except knowledge of the situation. Article written by Mrs. Tyler Thompson No, I will not make you a sandwich, but you can follow me on Twitter @MrsTylerKSR or email me . 50 responses to “Andy Katz says Louisville could be subject to a Level 1 case” Echo1 October 9, 2015 at 1:35
